name: Sweden
description: Sweden, officially the Kingdom of Sweden, is a Scandinavian nation known for its stunning natural landscapes, including vast forests, shimmering lakes, and dramatic coastlines. It boasts a rich history, vibrant culture, and a commitment to sustainability. From the Arctic north to the temperate south, Sweden offers a diverse range of experiences for visitors and residents alike.

quickFacts.label: Population
quickFacts.description: Sweden has a relatively small but highly educated and innovative population.
quickFacts.detail: The population density is around 25 people per square kilometer.

quickFacts.label: Area
quickFacts.description: Sweden is the fifth-largest country in Europe.
quickFacts.detail: Approximately 30% of the country is covered by forests.

quickFacts.label: Capital
quickFacts.description: Stockholm is a major European capital city and a global center for design and innovation.
quickFacts.detail: It's built on 14 islands and connected by 50 bridges.

quickFacts.label: Currency
quickFacts.description: The Swedish currency is the Krona.
quickFacts.detail: As of November 2023, 1 SEK is approximately $0.95 USD.

quickFacts.label: Official Language
quickFacts.description: Swedish is the official language of Sweden.
quickFacts.detail: Around 90% of the population speaks Swedish fluently.

climateData.title: Swedish Climate
climateData.description: Sweden experiences a wide range of climates due to its vast size. Generally, it's a temperate climate with significant variations between north and south. Summers are mild and pleasant, while winters are long, cold, and snowy, particularly in the north.

seasonalCharacteristics.name: Summer (June - August)
seasonalCharacteristics.description: Summer in Sweden is characterized by long daylight hours, warm temperatures, and lush greenery. It's a popular time for outdoor activities.

seasonalCharacteristics.name: Autumn (September - November)
seasonalCharacteristics.description: Autumn brings cooler temperatures, vibrant foliage, and a sense of tranquility. The days get shorter, and the landscape transforms into a stunning display of reds, oranges, and yellows.

seasonalCharacteristics.name: Winter (December - February)
seasonalCharacteristics.description: Winter in Sweden is cold and snowy, with long nights and a magical atmosphere. It's a time for cozying up indoors, enjoying winter sports, and experiencing the beauty of the snow-covered landscapes.

seasonalCharacteristics.name: Spring (March - May)
seasonalCharacteristics.description: Spring brings a gradual warming, melting snow, and the return of wildflowers. It's a time of renewal and rebirth, with longer daylight hours and blossoming landscapes.

naturalWonders.name: Abisko National Park
naturalWonders.description: Abisko National Park is renowned for its stunning mountain scenery, pristine lakes, and the mesmerizing Aurora Borealis (Northern Lights). It's a hiker's paradise and a prime location for wildlife viewing.
naturalWonders.detailedDescription: Located in Lapland, the park offers a variety of trails, from gentle lakeside walks to challenging mountain climbs. The Abisko Chasm, a deep gorge with a glass-bottomed walkway, provides a unique perspective on the landscape.
viewingTips: Find a dark location away from light pollution

naturalWonders.name: The Koster Islands
naturalWonders.description: The Koster Islands are a beautiful archipelago in the Gulf of Bothnia, known for their pristine beaches, diverse birdlife, and unique coastal landscapes. They offer a tranquil escape and a chance to experience the beauty of the Swedish coast.
naturalWonders.detailedDescription: The islands are characterized by sandy beaches, pine forests, and rocky cliffs. They are a haven for migratory birds, particularly during the summer months. The islands are also home to traditional Swedish fishing villages.

naturalWonders.name: Lake District of Vänern
naturalWonders.description: Vänern is Sweden’s largest lake and a stunning natural area, offering a diverse range of activities and landscapes. Surrounded by forests and charming towns, it’s a popular destination for boating, fishing, and relaxation.
naturalWonders.detailedDescription: The lake is dotted with islands, creating a labyrinthine network of waterways. The surrounding forests provide opportunities for hiking and camping. Vänern is also known for its rich history and cultural heritage.

ecosystemData.title: Swedish Ecosystems
ecosystemData.overview: Sweden boasts a diverse range of ecosystems, from boreal forests and arctic tundra to temperate deciduous forests and coastal wetlands. These ecosystems support a rich variety of plant and animal life, contributing to the country's biodiversity.

biodiversityCategories.name: Forests
biodiversityCategories.description: Sweden’s vast forests cover approximately 25% of the country and play a crucial role in carbon sequestration and biodiversity conservation.

statistics.details: A wide variety of tree species, including spruce, pine, birch, and aspen.
The largest forest area in Europe.

notableSpecies.name: European Roe Deer
notableSpecies.significance: An important prey species for predators.

notableSpecies.name: Black Grouse
notableSpecies.significance: A symbol of the Swedish wilderness.

biodiversityCategories.name: Wetlands
biodiversityCategories.description: Sweden’s wetlands, including marshes, bogs, and fens, are vital habitats for a wide range of species and play a crucial role in flood control and water purification.

statistics.details: A significant portion of Sweden’s land area is covered by wetlands.
Important breeding grounds for migratory birds.

notableSpecies.name: White-tailed Eagle
notableSpecies.significance: A top predator in the Swedish ecosystem.

notableSpecies.name: Marsh Beetle
notableSpecies.significance: A specialist species adapted to wetland habitats.

activities.title: Outdoor Activities in Sweden
activities.description: Sweden offers a wide range of outdoor activities for all skill levels, from hiking and fishing to skiing and kayaking. The country’s stunning natural landscapes provide the perfect backdrop for adventure and recreation.

activityCategories.name: Hiking
activityCategories.description: Sweden is a hiker’s paradise, with trails ranging from gentle lakeside walks to challenging mountain climbs.

activities.name: Day Hike
activities.description: A short hike to a scenic viewpoint or waterfall.
activities.requirements: Hiking boots, backpack, water bottle, snacks

activities.name: Multi-Day Trek
activities.description: A challenging trek through the wilderness, requiring careful planning and preparation.
activities.requirements: Tent, sleeping bag, cooking equipment, navigation tools

activityCategories.name: Water Sports
activityCategories.description: Sweden’s lakes and coastline offer a variety of water sports activities, from kayaking and canoeing to sailing and fishing.

activities.name: Kayaking
activities.description: Explore the lakes and waterways by kayak.

activities.name: Sailing
activities.description: Enjoy sailing on the lakes and coastline.

clothing.winter: Warm layers, waterproof jacket and pants, hat, gloves, scarf
clothing.yearRound: Versatile clothing that can be layered

equipment.hiking: Hiking boots, trekking poles, map, compass
